intro: Dufrenoya granulata, commonly known as the granulate dufrenoya, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, with five petals and a prominent yellow center. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
